title: Remove FAQ page and all FAQ navigation links

requirements.summary: Remove the FAQ route registration and all FAQPage imports/usages so the app no longer serves a FAQ page.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/App.tsx route tree no longer defines a route for path "/faq"
The app builds successfully with no unused/failed imports related to FAQPage

file_operations.description: Remove the FAQPage import and delete the /faq route definition from the TanStack Router route tree so the application no longer registers the FAQ route.
Delete the FAQPage implementation file to fully remove the FAQ page from the frontend codebase and avoid any accidental future imports.

requirements.summary: Remove all visible navigation links that reference the FAQ page.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx no longer renders a link to "/faq"
frontend/src/pages/SupportPage.tsx no longer renders a link to "/faq"
No other visible navigation element links to "/faq"

file_operations.description: Remove the Footer navigation Link that points to "/faq" (and any separators adjacent to it) so the FAQ is no longer reachable from the footer.
Remove the Support page Link that points to "/faq" and adjust the surrounding sentence to keep the copy intact while eliminating the FAQ reference (do not otherwise rewrite Support page copy).
Audit and remove any Header navigation element that links to "/faq" if present, ensuring there are no remaining UI navigation paths to the removed FAQ route.

requirements.summary: Ensure visiting /faq no longer shows FAQ content and instead shows a not-found experience with a clear path back to Home.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting "/faq" does not render the previous FAQ accordion content
The user is either redirected to "/" or shown a not-found page with a clear path back to Home

file_operations.description: Create a NotFoundPage that clearly indicates the page was not found and provides an obvious navigation action back to Home (e.g., a link/button to "/").

Register a catch-all not-found route (e.g., path "*") wired to NotFoundPage so that directly visiting "/faq" (and any unknown routes) renders the not-found experience rather than the removed FAQ content.
